title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: Thomas P. Jackson to R. M. Manly, October 18, 1867
summary: Jackson reports Miss Rowell's arrival as the new teacher, and immediately requests that she be sent a female companion, for Jackson fears the impropriety of her being unaccompanied, and has also struggled to find housing for her.
keywords: Education, Women, Community Values/Local Behavior, American Civil War
